publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

seg.seg: ... by the heart, [the patient is] sharp (= acid) in the mouth. Recognise the above (lit. before) as a symptom of cancer due to gall. He always becomes light (= bitter) in the mouth, ... (likewise he becomes breathless)
as if carrying a burden, and he may vomit [and] his nostrils are blocked up. Anxiety (= nausea) besets his body, [he is] confused and gets (sleepy during the day at inappropriate)
wird sich erbrechen
will vomit
moments. He has no appetite for food [and] his body is constantly satiated. ... Recognise (the above as a symptom)
of cancer due to phlegm. Now I will tell the medicine. 10 trau of Trigonella corniculata are to be cooked in milk. ... (This is to be drunk as)
Now I shall state the remedy (91)
medicine (against cancer). Sesame oil, milk, honey, [and] syrup are to be cooked in a vessel [so that] half [of it] remains. ...
Sesame oil, milk, honey, syrup should be cooked in a vessel so that half of it remains… (91)
Sesamöl, Milch, Honig [und] Syrup [sind] in Überschuss zu kochen. Die Hälfte [davon] soll übrigbleiben.
Sesame oil, milk, honey [and] syrup must be cooked in excess. Half [of it] shall remain.
... pepper is to be strewed in – this is to be drunk as a medicine against cancer. Sesame paste, castor-oil plant (are to be mixed with vinegar)
as an ointment against cancer. A molasses pill [is] the first (lit. one) remedy, fenugreek the second, a fish-gill pill (the third) ...
... the fourth, saltpetre the fifth. These remedies are to be drunk with milk as a medicine against cancer. (This tumour belongs to both) the gall (and wind. It occurs in [fertile] women only [and])
it does not occur in [fertile] men. I will now tell the symptom also of this. When it has not moved (?) for a long time
I will also state the symptom [lit. sign] of it (91)
when it is moved, or when it is moved suddenly, or when it is moved suddenly for [some] time, ...
their [i.e. of the women] abdomen grows, likewise the [menstrual] blood stands still. It is by the women valued as [being] pregnant. Further the abdomen is burning hot ...
von den Frauen wird er ... gewürdigt
by the women he is ... valued highly
... (nicht) wird der Penis ihnen schlaff, [sondern] steht im Blut/ steht, mit Blut [gefüllt], [und] wird von den Frauen [als] zeugungsfähig geschätzt.
... the[ir] penis does not go limp, [but] stands [filled] with blood, [and] is evaluated by the women as procreative.
becomes ... [Her] breasts have (= develop) froth, [she is] pale of appearance and she gets the desire [of a pregnant woman]. Vomiting ...

p.note: 46: "The end of the manuscript is missing, but the writing is in a perfect state of preservation. Written in medium ductus, the same hand as the preceding Stein manuscript" ().
Leaf number in the string hole space.
preke: possibly snai preke 'at inappropriate moments'.

list.item: a1 -ñcsa • _r_askare koyne • pittaṣṣepi kwaṃrmatse nau_ṣ\ ṣotri pkarsaso • laṃtse koyne ṣe_k\ _m_asket_r_a /// a2 perpette premane ra aṅkain yamalle _ṣ_p\ melyi taṅki _m_askeṃnt_r_a • iwate kektseṃne _m_aske_t_ar-ne tri[k]· /// a3 preke _m_aske_t_ar-ne • śwātsi mā āñme somo_t_k_aṃñe sosoyusa kektseñe _m_aske_t_a·e /// a4 -so kwärmatse leśpaṣṣepi || ñake sāṃtke weñau • cora_k\• traunta 10 malkwerne [_p_a]- /// a5 -tke || ṣalype kuñci_t_aṣṣe • malkwe_r\• mi_t\• pani_t\• aisene _p_akṣalle ywārtsa lipāt_r_a • /// a6 pippā_l\• eneṃ _k_atnālle te yokalle kwärmatse sāṃtke • || kuñcī_t\• mlyokotau • iran[t] a – /// b1 -rmattse laupe || pani_t_aṣṣe ṣpe_l\• ṣe prayo_k\ • wetene se wate • _l_aksaiñ[ai] – tsaiṣṣe – /// b2 śtarte • yavakṣā_r\• piṅkte • toyä\ prayo_k_anta malkwersa yokalyi kwärmatse sāṃtke || pi- /// b3 mā su _m_aske_t_a_r\ śrānät_s\• cwi rano ṣotri • weñau • mā walkeññe _p_as_tä\ yā- /// b4 yāmormeṃ istak wa_t\• _p_as_tä\ yāmormeṃ • istak wa_t\• prekesa yāmorme· • [y]·- /// b5 tso staukkana_t_ar-me śle yasar ka_lt_r_a klainat_s\• preṃtsa ynāñ_m\ yamast_r_a 3 _m_antak no tso erkatse sa – /// b6 -r _m_asket_r_a • _p_aścane leśpsa _m_aske_t_a_r\• erene yolyiya āñme _ṣ_p_a _m_aske_t_ar-ne 4 aṅ[k]aiṃ ///

a1 ... by the heart, [the patient is] sharp (= acid) in the mouth. Recognise the above (lit. before) as a symptom of cancer due to gall. He always becomes light (= bitter) in the mouth, ... (likewise he becomes breathless) a2 as if carrying a burden, and he may vomit [and] his nostrils are blocked up. Anxiety (= nausea) besets his body, [he is] confused and gets (sleepy during the day at inappropriate) a3 moments. He has no appetite for food [and] his body is constantly satiated. ... Recognise (the above as a symptom) a4 of cancer due to phlegm. Now I will tell the medicine. 10 trau of Trigonella corniculata are to be cooked in milk. ... (This is to be drunk as) a5 medicine (against cancer). Sesame oil, milk, honey, [and] syrup are to be cooked in a vessel [so that] half [of it] remains. ... a6 ... pepper is to be strewed in – this is to be drunk as a medicine against cancer. Sesame paste, castor-oil plant (are to be mixed with vinegar) b1 as an ointment against cancer. A molasses pill [is] the first (lit. one) remedy, fenugreek the second, a fish-gill pill (the third) ... b2 ... the fourth, saltpetre the fifth. These remedies are to be drunk with milk as a medicine against cancer. (This tumour belongs to both) the gall (and wind. It occurs in [fertile] women only [and]) b3 it does not occur in [fertile] men. I will now tell the symptom also of this. When it has not moved (?) for a long time b4 when it is moved, or when it is moved suddenly, or when it is moved suddenly for [some] time, ... b5 their [i.e. of the women] abdomen grows, likewise the [menstrual] blood stands still. It is by the women valued as [being] pregnant. Further the abdomen is burning hot ... b6 becomes ... [Her] breasts have (= develop) froth, [she is] pale of appearance and she gets the desire [of a pregnant woman]. Vomiting ...
St Ch.00316.a.2, Stein Ch. 00316 a², St.b., PK.3.B, P2

[[Broomhead I]]: 46: "The end of the manuscript is missing, but the writing is in a perfect state of preservation. Written in medium ductus, the same hand as the preceding Stein manuscript" ([[IOL Toch 305]]).

Leaf number in the string hole space.

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a4 Now I shall state the remedy ([[Carling 2003]]: 91) 656
a5 Sesame oil, milk, honey, syrup should be cooked in a vessel so that half of it remains… ([[Carling 2003]]: 91) 710
b3 I will also state the symptom [lit. sign] of it ([[Carling 2003]]: 91) 656


Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2 wird sich erbrechen 94
a5 Sesamöl, Milch, Honig [und] Syrup [sind] in Überschuss zu kochen. Die Hälfte [davon] soll übrigbleiben. 112
b5 von den Frauen wird er ... gewürdigt 230
b5 ... (nicht) wird der Penis ihnen schlaff, [sondern] steht im Blut/ steht, mit Blut [gefüllt], [und] wird von den Frauen [als] zeugungsfähig geschätzt. 114, 253-4


[[Broomhead I]]: 47 translates:

a1 in the heart, sharp in the mouth. Next know (ye) the symptom for a gallstone. [The patient] is always light in the mouth [and] will be vomiting like one who carries

a2 a heavy burden. His nostrills are blocked up. Anxiety [continually] besets his body. Confused ...

a3 Time is for him. He has no desire (appetite) for food. Equally his body is satiated. Know (ye) the symptom

a4 of a mucus growth. Now I shall teach the remedy. Ten traus of coraka are to be cooked in milk ... (as) remedy.

a5 Oil of sesame, milk, honey and syrup are to be cooked in abundance so that half (the quantity) remains.

a6 Pepper is to be scattered therein. That is to be drunk as a remedy gainst growth(s). Sesame, mlyokotau and the castor-oil plant

b1 (as) an embrocation against growth(s). A syrup pill is one method, vedhinī the second, a fish-gill pill (the third) ...

b2 the fourth, salpetre [is] the fifth. These methods/remedies are to be drunk in milk as remedy against growth(s).

b3 This will not be for the old. I shall also teach the symptom for this. Not slowly broken (?) off ...

b4 Having made ... and immediately broken off or immediately at the time having made ...

b5 His stomach becomes weak [and relaxed] and likewise the blood stands/stops. And in a moment he is respected by women. Still exactly so the stomach erkatse ...

b6 becomes. He becomes [afflicted] with mucus in the breasts. The stomach takes on a bad colour [and] he gets the desire to vomit.

[[Broomhead I]]: 47-48 also contains notes on the text and the language.

I changed transcription a2 aṅkaiṃ to aṅkain according to transliteration and image. –Martin (Wed, 2019-07-24, 23:36:22 (CEST))

arañcsa|(ara)|ñcsa a1 • räskare koyne • pittaṣṣepi kwärmantse|kwaṃrmatse nauṣ ṣotri pkarsas|pkarsaso • laṅkutse|laṃtse koyne ṣek mäsketrä /// a2 perpette premane ra aṅkaiṃ|aṅkain yamalle ṣp melyi taṅki mäskeṃnträ • iwate kektsenne|kektseṃne mäsketär-ne trik(au)/// a3 preke mäsketär-ne • śwātsi mā āñme somotkäññe|somotkäṃñe sosoyusa kektseñe mäsketä(r-n)e /// pkarsas|(pkarsa)|so a4 kwärmantse|kwärmatse leśpaṣṣepi || ñake sāṃtke weñau • corak traunta 10 malkwerne pä(kṣalle) /// sāṃtke|(sāṃ)|tke a5 || ṣalype kuñcitäṣṣe • malkwer mit panit aisene päkṣalle ywārtsa lipāträ • /// a6 pippāl eneṃ kätnālle te yokalle kwärmantse|kwärmatse sāṃtke • || kuñcīt mlyokotau • irant a – /// kwärmantse|(kwä)|rmattse b1 laupe || panitäṣṣe ṣpel ṣe prayok • wetene se wate • läksaiñai (klau)tsaiṣṣe – /// b2 śtarte • yavakṣār piṅkte • toy prayokänta malkwersa yokalyi kwärmantse|kwärmatse sāṃtke || pi(tta) /// b3 mā su mäsketär śrānäts cwi rano ṣotri • weñau • mā walkeññe päst yā(mormeṃ) /// b4 yāmormeṃ istak wat päst yāmormeṃ • istak wat prekesa yāmorme(ṃ) • y·- /// b5 tso staukkanatär-me śle yasar kalträ klainats preṃtsa ynāñm yamasträ 3 #3d mäntak no tso erkatse sa – /// b6 -r mäsketrä • päścane leśpsa mäsketär erene yolyiya āñme ṣpä mäsketär-ne 4 #4d aṅkaiṃ ///

div.p: <citedRange>47</citedRange></bibl> translates: </p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a1"/> in the heart, sharp in the mouth. Next know (ye) the symptom for a gallstone. [The patient] is always light in the mouth [and] will be vomiting like one who carries </p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a2"/> a heavy burden. His nostrills are blocked up. Anxiety [continually] besets his body. Confused ...</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a3"/> Time is for him. He has no desire (appetite) for food. Equally his body is satiated. Know (ye) the symptom</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a4"/> of a mucus growth. Now I shall teach the remedy. Ten traus of coraka are to be cooked in milk ... (as) remedy.</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a5"/> Oil of sesame, milk, honey and syrup are to be cooked in abundance so that half (the quantity) remains. </p><p><ref type="ms" target="__a6"/> Pepper is to be scattered therein. That is to be drunk as a remedy gainst growth(s). Sesame, mlyokotau and the castor-oil plant</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b1"/> (as) an embrocation against growth(s). A syrup pill is one method, vedhinī the second, a fish-gill pill (the third) ...</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b2"/> the fourth, salpetre [is] the fifth. These methods/remedies are to be drunk in milk as remedy against growth(s).</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b3"/> This will not be for the old. I shall also teach the symptom for this. Not slowly broken (?) off ... </p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b4"/> Having made ... and immediately broken off or immediately at the time having made ...</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b5"/> His stomach becomes weak [and relaxed] and likewise the blood stands/stops. And in a moment he is respected by women. Still exactly so the stomach erkatse ...</p><p><ref type="ms" target="__b6"/> becomes. He becomes [afflicted] with mucus in the breasts. The stomach takes on a bad colour [and] he gets the desire to vomit. </p><p><bibl><title corresp="ref:broomhead1962"/><citedRange>47-48</citedRange></bibl> also contains notes on the text and the language.</p><p>I changed transcription <ref type="ms" target="__a2"/> <hi>aṅkaiṃ</hi> to <hi>aṅkain</hi> according to transliteration and image. –Martin (Wed, 2019-07-24, 23:36:22 (CEST))</p></project_comment>
